May 1st, 1880. Catalogues of the students attending the early sessions have never before been published. James F. Harrison, Chairman.

BOARD OF VISITORS. JAMES MADISON, Rector. JAMES MADISON, CHAPMAN JOHNSON, JOSEPH C. CABELL, JAMES BRECKENRIDGE, JOHN H. COCKE, THOMAS JEFF. RANDOLPH. WILLIAM H. BROADNAX, Secretary of the Board, FRANK CARR.

FACULTY AND OFFICERS. ROBERT M. PATTERSON, Chairman of the Faculty. GESSNER HARRISON, Professor of Ancient Languages. GEO. W. BLÆTTERMANN, Professor of Modern Languages. CHARLES BONNYCASTLE, Professor of Mathematics. ROBERT M. PATTERSON, Professor of Natural Philosophy. JOHN P. EMMET, Professor of Chemistry and Mat. Med. GEORGE TUCKER, Professor of Moral Philosophy. ROBLEY DUNGLISON, Professor of Physiology, Medicine, Obstetrics and Medical Jurisprudence. JOHN A. G. DAVIS, Ppofessor of Law. THOMAS JOHNSON, Demonstrator of Anatomy and Surgery. GESSNER HARRISON. Secretary of the Faculty. WM. H. BROCKENBROUGH, Librarian. JOHN A. CARR, Proctor. ALEXANDER GARRETT, Bursar. Chaplain.

CATALOGUE OF STUDENTS. EIGHTH SESSION.—1831-1832. ABBREVIATIONS. A. L.—Ancient Languages. M. L.—Modern Languages. M.—Mathematics. N. P.—Natural Philosophy. C.—Chemistry. M. P.—Moral Philosophy. MED.—Medicine. A. & S.—Anatomy & Surgery. NAMES. RESIDENCES. SCHOOLS ATTENDED. SES. Alston, Wm. Ashe Georgetown, S. C. LAW, 2 Ambler, William M. Richmond, Va. M L, N P, C, 1 Amis, Thomas Jackson, N.
